column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////As my original review stated
column2: there was nothing wrong with the dinner itself; the steak was fantastic as were the sides. But as most lovers of top tier steakhouses know
column3: the ambiance and atmosphere is critical to the experience....eating a $90 Prime Rib on picnic table next to a road being freshly tarred does not make for a memorable meal
column4: the entire experience quantifies the real caliber of the meal. The service
column6: the food combines to create a nexus of the time spent there and the elements cannot be easily separated. When the atmosphere is offensive
column7: it ruins the rest. That's what happened to us.
